rComments: I liked that he is on time, shows interest in our answers, smiles, likes when students answer questions. But his English is bad, I noticed errors. And he is hard to understand. A teacher must have better English. His grading was not clear and he rarely read our homework. If you have him just work for your grade and learn English in other classes.
At any time on his class you would try your best to watching how much time is remaining.

If you are 10 seconds late,he will deduct a point from your attendance!A lot of homework after every class,and he hardly reads any.He has kicked a student out because that student  was using facebook!

Crazy class He once kicked a student out of the classroom just because the student was using cellphone;Too much homework and poorly graded;freshmen if you don't want to get your first D from a class costs half of your life in the beginning of your college life,AVOID.

He is actually instructor . But the class English as Second Language is a mandatory class for international students . I leave this comment only for the good of people who don't know which teacher to choose . He leaves homework as much as the total of all other classes combined together and he grade you poorly with the rules he never mentioned .
